text: Frederick Sasakamoose, (December 25, 1933 â€” November 24, 2020) was a Canadian professional ice hockey player. He was one of the first Canadian indigenous players in the National Hockey League. He played 11 games with the Chicago Black Hawks from 1953 to 1960. He was born in Debden, Saskatchewan. Sasakamoose died on November 24, 2020 in Prince Albert, Saskatchewan from COVID-19 at the age of 86. ==References== Category:1933 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic in Canada Category:Chicago Blackhawks players Category:Ice hockey people from Saskatchewan
title: Fred Sasakamoose
